metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1585 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In all versions of AppArmor mount rules are accidentally widened when compiled.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1585` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apparmor - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
apparmor-notify - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
apparmor-profiles - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
apparmor-utils - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
dh-apparmor - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
libapache2-mod-apparmor - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
libapparmor1 - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
libpam-apparmor - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
python3-apparmor - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
python3-libapparmor - 4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> Original fix introduced a regression, requiring the fix from https://gitlab.com/apparmor/apparmor/-/merge_requests/1048 as well sbeattie> additional regression fix in https://gitlab.com/apparmor/apparmor/-/merge_requests/1054

criterions.comment: apparmor package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.0~alpha2-0ubuntu5').
